040package org.jfree.chart.plot;
041
042import java.awt.BasicStroke;
043import java.awt.Color;
044import java.awt.Font;
045import java.awt.FontMetrics;
046import java.awt.Graphics2D;
047import java.awt.Paint;
048import java.awt.Stroke;
049import java.awt.geom.Area;
050import java.awt.geom.Ellipse2D;
051import java.awt.geom.Line2D;
052import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
053import java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D;
054import java.awt.geom.RoundRectangle2D;
055import java.io.IOException;
056import java.io.ObjectInputStream;
057import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
058import java.io.Serializable;
059import java.text.DecimalFormat;
060import java.text.NumberFormat;
061import java.util.Arrays;
062import java.util.Objects;
063import java.util.ResourceBundle;
064import org.jfree.chart.ChartElementVisitor;

066import org.jfree.chart.legend.LegendItemCollection;
067import org.jfree.chart.axis.NumberAxis;
068import org.jfree.chart.axis.ValueAxis;
069import org.jfree.chart.event.PlotChangeEvent;
070import org.jfree.chart.api.RectangleEdge;
071import org.jfree.chart.api.RectangleInsets;
072import org.jfree.chart.internal.CloneUtils;
073import org.jfree.chart.internal.PaintUtils;
074import org.jfree.chart.internal.Args;
075import org.jfree.chart.internal.SerialUtils;
076import org.jfree.chart.api.UnitType;
077import org.jfree.data.Range;
078import org.jfree.data.general.DatasetChangeEvent;
079import org.jfree.data.general.DefaultValueDataset;
080import org.jfree.data.general.ValueDataset;
081
082/**
083 * A plot that displays a single value (from a {@link ValueDataset}) in a
084 * thermometer type display.
085 * <p>
086 * This plot supports a number of options:
087 * <ol>
088 * <li>three sub-ranges which could be viewed as 'Normal', 'Warning'
089 *   and 'Critical' ranges.</li>
090 * <li>the thermometer can be run in two modes:
091 *      <ul>
092 *      <li>fixed range, or</li>
093 *      <li>range adjusts to current sub-range.</li>
094 *      </ul>
095 * </li>
096 * <li>settable units to be displayed.</li>
097 * <li>settable display location for the value text.</li>
098 * </ol>
099 */
100public class ThermometerPlot extends Plot implements ValueAxisPlot,
101        Zoomable, Cloneable, Serializable {
102
103    private ThermometerPlotProduct thermometerPlotProduct = new ThermometerPlotProduct();
104
105        /** For serialization. */
106    private static final long serialVersionUID = 4087093313147984390L;
107
108    /** A constant for unit type 'None'. */
109    public static final int UNITS_NONE = 0;
110
111    /** A constant for unit type 'Fahrenheit'. */
112    public static final int UNITS_FAHRENHEIT = 1;
113
114    /** A constant for unit type 'Celcius'. */
115    public static final int UNITS_CELCIUS = 2;
116
117    /** A constant for unit type 'Kelvin'. */
118    public static final int UNITS_KELVIN = 3;
119
120    /** A constant for the value label position (no label). */
121    public static final int NONE = 0;
122
123    /** A constant for the value label position (right of the thermometer). */
124    public static final int RIGHT = 1;
125
126    /** A constant for the value label position (left of the thermometer). */
127    public static final int LEFT = 2;
128
129    /** A constant for the value label position (in the thermometer bulb). */
130    public static final int BULB = 3;
131
132    /** A constant for the 'normal' range. */
133    public static final int NORMAL = 0;
134
135    /** A constant for the 'warning' range. */
136    public static final int WARNING = 1;
137
138    /** A constant for the 'critical' range. */
139    public static final int CRITICAL = 2;
140
141    /** The axis gap. */
142    protected static final int AXIS_GAP = 10;
143
144    /** The unit strings. */
145    protected static final String[] UNITS = {"", "\u00B0F", "\u00B0C",
146            "\u00B0K"};
147
148    /** Index for low value in subrangeInfo matrix. */
149    protected static final int RANGE_LOW = 0;
150
151    /** Index for high value in subrangeInfo matrix. */
152    protected static final int RANGE_HIGH = 1;
153
154    /** Index for display low value in subrangeInfo matrix. */
155    protected static final int DISPLAY_LOW = 2;
156
157    /** Index for display high value in subrangeInfo matrix. */
158    protected static final int DISPLAY_HIGH = 3;
159
160    /** The default lower bound. */
161    protected static final double DEFAULT_LOWER_BOUND = 0.0;
162
163    /** The default upper bound. */
164    protected static final double DEFAULT_UPPER_BOUND = 100.0;
165
166    /**
167     * The default bulb radius.
168     */
169    protected static final int DEFAULT_BULB_RADIUS = 40;
170
171    /**
172     * The default column radius.
173     */
174    protected static final int DEFAULT_COLUMN_RADIUS = 20;
175
176    /**
177     * The default gap between the outlines representing the thermometer.
178     */
179    protected static final int DEFAULT_GAP = 5;
180
181    /** The dataset for the plot. */
182    private ValueDataset dataset;
183
184    /** The range axis. */
185    private ValueAxis rangeAxis;
186
187    /** The lower bound for the thermometer. */
188    private double lowerBound = DEFAULT_LOWER_BOUND;
189
190    /** The upper bound for the thermometer. */
191    private double upperBound = DEFAULT_UPPER_BOUND;
192
193    /**
194     * The value label position.
195     */
196    private int bulbRadius = DEFAULT_BULB_RADIUS;
197
198    /**
199     * The column radius.
200     */
201    private int columnRadius = DEFAULT_COLUMN_RADIUS;
202
203    /**
204     * The gap between the two outlines the represent the thermometer.
205     */
206    private int gap = DEFAULT_GAP;
207
208    /**
209     * Blank space inside the plot area around the outside of the thermometer.
210     */
211    private RectangleInsets padding;
212
213    /** Stroke for drawing the thermometer */
214    private transient Stroke thermometerStroke = new BasicStroke(1.0f);
215
216    /** Paint for drawing the thermometer */
217    private transient Paint thermometerPaint = Color.BLACK;
218
219    /** The display units */
220    private int units = UNITS_CELCIUS;
221
222    /** The value label position. */
223    private int valueLocation = BULB;
224
225    /** The position of the axis **/
226    private int axisLocation = LEFT;
227
228    /** The font to write the value in */
229    private Font valueFont = new Font("SansSerif", Font.BOLD, 16);
230
231    /** Colour that the value is written in */
232    private transient Paint valuePaint = Color.WHITE;
233
234    /** Number format for the value */
235    private NumberFormat valueFormat = new DecimalFormat();
236
237    /** The default paint for the mercury in the thermometer. */
238    private transient Paint mercuryPaint = Color.LIGHT_GRAY;
239
240    /** A flag that controls whether value lines are drawn. */
241    private boolean showValueLines = false;
242
243    /** The display sub-range. */
244    private int subrange = -1;
245
246    /**
247     * A flag that controls whether or not the axis range adjusts to the
248     * sub-ranges.
249     */
250    private boolean followDataInSubranges = false;
251
252    /**
253     * A flag that controls whether or not the mercury paint changes with
254     * the subranges.
255     */
256    private boolean useSubrangePaint = true;
257
258    /** Paint for each range */
259    private transient Paint[] subrangePaint = {Color.GREEN, Color.ORANGE,
260            Color.RED};
261
262    /** A flag that controls whether the sub-range indicators are visible. */
263    private boolean subrangeIndicatorsVisible = true;
264
265    /** The stroke for the sub-range indicators. */
266    private transient Stroke subrangeIndicatorStroke = new BasicStroke(2.0f);
267
268    /** The range indicator stroke. */
269    private transient Stroke rangeIndicatorStroke = new BasicStroke(3.0f);
270
271    /** The resourceBundle for the localization. */
272    protected static ResourceBundle localizationResources
273            = ResourceBundle.getBundle("org.jfree.chart.plot.LocalizationBundle");
274
275    /**
276     * Creates a new thermometer plot.
277     */
278    public ThermometerPlot() {
279        this(new DefaultValueDataset());
280    }
281
282    /**
283     * Creates a new thermometer plot, using default attributes where necessary.
284     *
285     * @param dataset  the data set.
286     */
287    public ThermometerPlot(ValueDataset dataset) {
288
289        super();
290
291        this.padding = new RectangleInsets(UnitType.RELATIVE, 0.05, 0.05, 0.05,
292                0.05);
293        this.dataset = dataset;
294        if (dataset != null) {
295            dataset.addChangeListener(this);
296        }
297        NumberAxis axis = new NumberAxis(null);
298        axis.setStandardTickUnits(NumberAxis.createIntegerTickUnits());
299        axis.setAxisLineVisible(false);
300        axis.setPlot(this);
301        axis.addChangeListener(this);
302        this.rangeAxis = axis;
303        setAxisRange();
304    }
305
306    /**
307     * Returns the dataset for the plot.
308     *
309     * @return The dataset (possibly {@code null}).
310     *
311     * @see #setDataset(ValueDataset)
312     */
313    public ValueDataset getDataset() {
314        return this.dataset;
315    }
316
317    /**
318     * Sets the dataset for the plot, replacing the existing dataset if there
319     * is one, and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
320     *
321     * @param dataset  the dataset ({@code null} permitted).
322     *
323     * @see #getDataset()
324     */
325    public void setDataset(ValueDataset dataset) {
326
327        // if there is an existing dataset, remove the plot from the list
328        // of change listeners...
329        ValueDataset existing = this.dataset;
330        if (existing != null) {
331            existing.removeChangeListener(this);
332        }
333
334        // set the new dataset, and register the chart as a change listener...
335        this.dataset = dataset;
336        if (dataset != null) {
337            dataset.addChangeListener(this);
338        }
339
340        // send a dataset change event to self...
341        DatasetChangeEvent event = new DatasetChangeEvent(this, dataset);
342        datasetChanged(event);
343
344    }
345
346    /**
347     * Returns the range axis.
348     *
349     * @return The range axis (never {@code null}).
350     *
351     * @see #setRangeAxis(ValueAxis)
352     */
353    public ValueAxis getRangeAxis() {
354        return this.rangeAxis;
355    }
356
357    /**
358     * Sets the range axis for the plot and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to
359     * all registered listeners.
360     *
361     * @param axis  the new axis ({@code null} not permitted).
362     *
363     * @see #getRangeAxis()
364     */
365    public void setRangeAxis(ValueAxis axis) {
366        Args.nullNotPermitted(axis, "axis");
367        // plot is registered as a listener with the existing axis...
368        this.rangeAxis.removeChangeListener(this);
369
370        axis.setPlot(this);
371        axis.addChangeListener(this);
372        this.rangeAxis = axis;
373        fireChangeEvent();
374    }
375
376    /**
377     * Returns the lower bound for the thermometer.  The data value can be set
378     * lower than this, but it will not be shown in the thermometer.
379     *
380     * @return The lower bound.
381     *
382     * @see #setLowerBound(double)
383     */
384    public double getLowerBound() {
385        return this.lowerBound;
386    }
387
388    /**
389     * Sets the lower bound for the thermometer.
390     *
391     * @param lower the lower bound.
392     *
393     * @see #getLowerBound()
394     */
395    public void setLowerBound(double lower) {
396        this.lowerBound = lower;
397        setAxisRange();
398    }
399
400    /**
401     * Returns the upper bound for the thermometer.  The data value can be set
402     * higher than this, but it will not be shown in the thermometer.
403     *
404     * @return The upper bound.
405     *
406     * @see #setUpperBound(double)
407     */
408    public double getUpperBound() {
409        return this.upperBound;
410    }
411
412    /**
413     * Sets the upper bound for the thermometer.
414     *
415     * @param upper the upper bound.
416     *
417     * @see #getUpperBound()
418     */
419    public void setUpperBound(double upper) {
420        this.upperBound = upper;
421        setAxisRange();
422    }
423
424    /**
425     * Sets the lower and upper bounds for the thermometer.
426     *
427     * @param lower  the lower bound.
428     * @param upper  the upper bound.
429     */
430    public void setRange(double lower, double upper) {
431        this.lowerBound = lower;
432        this.upperBound = upper;
433        setAxisRange();
434    }
435
436    /**
437     * Returns the padding for the thermometer.  This is the space inside the
438     * plot area.
439     *
440     * @return The padding (never {@code null}).
441     *
442     * @see #setPadding(RectangleInsets)
443     */
444    public RectangleInsets getPadding() {
445        return this.padding;
446    }
447
448    /**
449     * Sets the padding for the thermometer and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent}
450     * to all registered listeners.
451     *
452     * @param padding  the padding ({@code null} not permitted).
453     *
454     * @see #getPadding()
455     */
456    public void setPadding(RectangleInsets padding) {
457        Args.nullNotPermitted(padding, "padding");
458        this.padding = padding;
459        fireChangeEvent();
460    }
461
462    /**
463     * Returns the stroke used to draw the thermometer outline.
464     *
465     * @return The stroke (never {@code null}).
466     *
467     * @see #setThermometerStroke(Stroke)
468     * @see #getThermometerPaint()
469     */
470    public Stroke getThermometerStroke() {
471        return this.thermometerStroke;
472    }
473
474    /**
475     * Sets the stroke used to draw the thermometer outline and sends a
476     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
477     *
478     * @param s  the new stroke ({@code null} ignored).
479     *
480     * @see #getThermometerStroke()
481     */
482    public void setThermometerStroke(Stroke s) {
483        if (s != null) {
484            this.thermometerStroke = s;
485            fireChangeEvent();
486        }
487    }
488
489    /**
490     * Returns the paint used to draw the thermometer outline.
491     *
492     * @return The paint (never {@code null}).
493     *
494     * @see #setThermometerPaint(Paint)
495     * @see #getThermometerStroke()
496     */
497    public Paint getThermometerPaint() {
498        return this.thermometerPaint;
499    }
500
501    /**
502     * Sets the paint used to draw the thermometer outline and sends a
503     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
504     *
505     * @param paint  the new paint ({@code null} ignored).
506     *
507     * @see #getThermometerPaint()
508     */
509    public void setThermometerPaint(Paint paint) {
510        if (paint != null) {
511            this.thermometerPaint = paint;
512            fireChangeEvent();
513        }
514    }
515
516    /**
517     * Returns a code indicating the unit display type.  This is one of
518     * {@link #UNITS_NONE}, {@link #UNITS_FAHRENHEIT}, {@link #UNITS_CELCIUS}
519     * and {@link #UNITS_KELVIN}.
520     *
521     * @return The units type.
522     *
523     * @see #setUnits(int)
524     */
525    public int getUnits() {
526        return this.units;
527    }
528
529    /**
530     * Sets the units to be displayed in the thermometer. Use one of the
531     * following constants:
532     *
533     * <ul>
534     * <li>UNITS_NONE : no units displayed.</li>
535     * <li>UNITS_FAHRENHEIT : units displayed in Fahrenheit.</li>
536     * <li>UNITS_CELCIUS : units displayed in Celcius.</li>
537     * <li>UNITS_KELVIN : units displayed in Kelvin.</li>
538     * </ul>
539     *
540     * @param u  the new unit type.
541     *
542     * @see #getUnits()
543     */
544    public void setUnits(int u) {
545        if ((u >= 0) && (u < UNITS.length)) {
546            if (this.units != u) {
547                this.units = u;
548                fireChangeEvent();
549            }
550        }
551    }
552
553    /**
554     * Returns a code indicating the location at which the value label is
555     * displayed.
556     *
557     * @return The location (one of {@link #NONE}, {@link #RIGHT},
558     *         {@link #LEFT} and {@link #BULB}.).
559     */
560    public int getValueLocation() {
561        return this.valueLocation;
562    }
563
564    /**
565     * Sets the location at which the current value is displayed and sends a
566     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
567     * <P>
568     * The location can be one of the constants: {@code NONE}, {@code RIGHT},
569     * {@code LEFT} and {@code BULB}.
570     *
571     * @param location  the location.
572     */
573    public void setValueLocation(int location) {
574        if ((location >= 0) && (location < 4)) {
575            this.valueLocation = location;
576            fireChangeEvent();
577        }
578        else {
579            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Location not recognised.");
580        }
581    }
582
583    /**
584     * Returns the axis location.
585     *
586     * @return The location (one of {@link #NONE}, {@link #LEFT} and
587     *         {@link #RIGHT}).
588     *
589     * @see #setAxisLocation(int)
590     */
591    public int getAxisLocation() {
592        return this.axisLocation;
593    }
594
595    /**
596     * Sets the location at which the axis is displayed relative to the
597     * thermometer, and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered
598     * listeners.
599     *
600     * @param location  the location (one of {@link #NONE}, {@link #LEFT} and
601     *         {@link #RIGHT}).
602     *
603     * @see #getAxisLocation()
604     */
605    public void setAxisLocation(int location) {
606        if ((location >= 0) && (location < 3)) {
607            this.axisLocation = location;
608            fireChangeEvent();
609        }
610        else {
611            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Location not recognised.");
612        }
613    }
614
615    /**
616     * Gets the font used to display the current value.
617     *
618     * @return The font.
619     *
620     * @see #setValueFont(Font)
621     */
622    public Font getValueFont() {
623        return this.valueFont;
624    }
625
626    /**
627     * Sets the font used to display the current value.
628     *
629     * @param f  the new font ({@code null} not permitted).
630     *
631     * @see #getValueFont()
632     */
633    public void setValueFont(Font f) {
634        Args.nullNotPermitted(f, "f");
635        if (!this.valueFont.equals(f)) {
636            this.valueFont = f;
637            fireChangeEvent();
638        }
639    }
640
641    /**
642     * Gets the paint used to display the current value.
643    *
644     * @return The paint.
645     *
646     * @see #setValuePaint(Paint)
647     */
648    public Paint getValuePaint() {
649        return this.valuePaint;
650    }
651
652    /**
653     * Sets the paint used to display the current value and sends a
654     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
655     *
656     * @param paint  the new paint ({@code null} not permitted).
657     *
658     * @see #getValuePaint()
659     */
660    public void setValuePaint(Paint paint) {
661        Args.nullNotPermitted(paint, "paint");
662        if (!this.valuePaint.equals(paint)) {
663            this.valuePaint = paint;
664            fireChangeEvent();
665        }
666    }
667

669

671     * Sets the formatter for the value label and sends a
672     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
673     *
674     * @param formatter  the new formatter ({@code null} not permitted).
675     */
676    public void setValueFormat(NumberFormat formatter) {
677        Args.nullNotPermitted(formatter, "formatter");
678        this.valueFormat = formatter;
679        fireChangeEvent();
680    }
681
682    /**
683     * Returns the default mercury paint.
684     *
685     * @return The paint (never {@code null}).
686     *
687     * @see #setMercuryPaint(Paint)
688     */
689    public Paint getMercuryPaint() {
690        return this.mercuryPaint;
691    }
692
693    /**
694     * Sets the default mercury paint and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to
695     * all registered listeners.
696     *
697     * @param paint  the new paint ({@code null} not permitted).
698     *
699     * @see #getMercuryPaint()
700     */
701    public void setMercuryPaint(Paint paint) {
702        Args.nullNotPermitted(paint, "paint");
703        this.mercuryPaint = paint;
704        fireChangeEvent();
705    }
706
707    /**
708     * Sets information for a particular range.
709     *
710     * @param range  the range to specify information about.
711     * @param low  the low value for the range
712     * @param hi  the high value for the range
713     */
714    public void setSubrangeInfo(int range, double low, double hi) {
715        thermometerPlotProduct.setSubrangeInfo(range, low, hi, low, hi, this);
716    }
717
718    /**
719     * Sets the subrangeInfo attribute of the ThermometerPlot object
720     *
721     * @param range  the new rangeInfo value.
722     * @param rangeLow  the new rangeInfo value
723     * @param rangeHigh  the new rangeInfo value
724     * @param displayLow  the new rangeInfo value
725     * @param displayHigh  the new rangeInfo value
726     */
727    public void setSubrangeInfo(int range,
728                                double rangeLow, double rangeHigh,
729                                double displayLow, double displayHigh) {
730
731        thermometerPlotProduct.setSubrangeInfo(range, rangeLow, rangeHigh, displayLow, displayHigh, this);
732
733    }
734
735    /**
736     * Sets the bounds for a subrange.
737     *
738     * @param range  the range type.
739     * @param low  the low value.
740     * @param high  the high value.
741     */
742    public void setSubrange(int range, double low, double high) {
743        thermometerPlotProduct.setSubrange(range, low, high);
744    }
745
746    /**
747     * Sets the displayed bounds for a sub range.
748     *
749     * @param range  the range type.
750     * @param low  the low value.
751     * @param high  the high value.
752     */
753    public void setDisplayRange(int range, double low, double high) {
754
755        thermometerPlotProduct.setDisplayRange(range, low, high);
756
757    }
758
759    /**
760     * Gets the paint used for a particular subrange.
761     *
762     * @param range  the range (.
763     *
764     * @return The paint.
765     *
766     * @see #setSubrangePaint(int, Paint)
767     */
768    public Paint getSubrangePaint(int range) {
769        if ((range >= 0) && (range < this.subrangePaint.length)) {
770            return this.subrangePaint[range];
771        }
772        else {
773            return this.mercuryPaint;
774        }
775    }
776
777    /**
778     * Sets the paint to be used for a subrange and sends a
779     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
780     *
781     * @param range  the range (0, 1 or 2).
782     * @param paint  the paint to be applied ({@code null} not permitted).
783     *
784     * @see #getSubrangePaint(int)
785     */
786    public void setSubrangePaint(int range, Paint paint) {
787        if ((range >= 0)
788                && (range < this.subrangePaint.length) && (paint != null)) {
789            this.subrangePaint[range] = paint;
790            fireChangeEvent();
791        }
792    }
793
794    /**
795     * Returns a flag that controls whether or not the thermometer axis zooms
796     * to display the subrange within which the data value falls.
797     *
798     * @return The flag.
799     */
800    public boolean getFollowDataInSubranges() {
801        return this.followDataInSubranges;
802    }
803
804    /**
805     * Sets the flag that controls whether or not the thermometer axis zooms
806     * to display the subrange within which the data value falls.
807     *
808     * @param flag  the flag.
809     */
810    public void setFollowDataInSubranges(boolean flag) {
811        this.followDataInSubranges = flag;
812        fireChangeEvent();
813    }
814
815    /**
816     * Returns a flag that controls whether or not the mercury color changes
817     * for each subrange.
818     *
819     * @return The flag.
820     *
821     * @see #setUseSubrangePaint(boolean)
822     */
823    public boolean getUseSubrangePaint() {
824        return this.useSubrangePaint;
825    }
826
827    /**
828     * Sets the range colour change option.
829     *
830     * @param flag the new range colour change option
831     *
832     * @see #getUseSubrangePaint()
833     */
834    public void setUseSubrangePaint(boolean flag) {
835        this.useSubrangePaint = flag;
836        fireChangeEvent();
837    }
838
839    /**
840     * Returns the bulb radius, in Java2D units.
841
842     * @return The bulb radius.
843     */
844    public int getBulbRadius() {
845        return this.bulbRadius;
846    }
847
848    /**
849     * Sets the bulb radius (in Java2D units) and sends a
850     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
851     *
852     * @param r  the new radius (in Java2D units).
853     *
854     * @see #getBulbRadius()
855     */
856    public void setBulbRadius(int r) {
857        this.bulbRadius = r;
858        fireChangeEvent();
859    }
860
861    /**
862     * Returns the bulb diameter, which is always twice the value returned
863     * by {@link #getBulbRadius()}.
864     *
865     * @return The bulb diameter.
866     */
867    public int getBulbDiameter() {
868        return getBulbRadius() * 2;
869    }
870
871    /**
872     * Returns the column radius, in Java2D units.
873     *
874     * @return The column radius.
875     *
876     * @see #setColumnRadius(int)
877     */
878    public int getColumnRadius() {
879        return this.columnRadius;
880    }
881
882    /**
883     * Sets the column radius (in Java2D units) and sends a
884     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
885     *
886     * @param r  the new radius.
887     *
888     * @see #getColumnRadius()
889     */
890    public void setColumnRadius(int r) {
891        this.columnRadius = r;
892        fireChangeEvent();
893    }
894
895    /**
896     * Returns the column diameter, which is always twice the value returned
897     * by {@link #getColumnRadius()}.
898     *
899     * @return The column diameter.
900     */
901    public int getColumnDiameter() {
902        return getColumnRadius() * 2;
903    }
904
905    /**
906     * Returns the gap, in Java2D units, between the two outlines that
907     * represent the thermometer.
908     *
909     * @return The gap.
910     *
911     * @see #setGap(int)
912     */
913    public int getGap() {
914        return this.gap;
915    }
916
917    /**
918     * Sets the gap (in Java2D units) between the two outlines that represent
919     * the thermometer, and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered
920     * listeners.
921     *
922     * @param gap  the new gap.
923     *
924     * @see #getGap()
925     */
926    public void setGap(int gap) {
927        this.gap = gap;
928        fireChangeEvent();
929    }
930
931    /**
932     * Receives a chart element visitor.
933     * 
934     * @param visitor  the visitor ({@code null} not permitted).
935     */
936    @Override
937    public void receive(ChartElementVisitor visitor) {
938        this.rangeAxis.receive(visitor);
939        super.receive(visitor);
940    }
941
942    /**
943     * Draws the plot on a Java 2D graphics device (such as the screen or a
944     * printer).
945     *
946     * @param g2  the graphics device.
947     * @param area  the area within which the plot should be drawn.
948     * @param anchor  the anchor point ({@code null} permitted).
949     * @param parentState  the state from the parent plot, if there is one.
950     * @param info  collects info about the drawing.
951     */
952    @Override
953    public void draw(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area, Point2D anchor,
954            PlotState parentState, PlotRenderingInfo info) {
955
956        RoundRectangle2D outerStem = new RoundRectangle2D.Double();
957        RoundRectangle2D innerStem = new RoundRectangle2D.Double();
958        RoundRectangle2D mercuryStem = new RoundRectangle2D.Double();
959        Ellipse2D outerBulb = new Ellipse2D.Double();
960        Ellipse2D innerBulb = new Ellipse2D.Double();
961        String temp;
962        FontMetrics metrics;
963        if (info != null) {
964            info.setPlotArea(area);
965        }
966
967        // adjust for insets...
968        RectangleInsets insets = getInsets();
969        insets.trim(area);
970        drawBackground(g2, area);
971
972        // adjust for padding...
973        Rectangle2D interior = (Rectangle2D) area.clone();
974        this.padding.trim(interior);
975        int midX = (int) (interior.getX() + (interior.getWidth() / 2));
976        int midY = (int) (interior.getY() + (interior.getHeight() / 2));
977        int stemTop = (int) (interior.getMinY() + getBulbRadius());
978        int stemBottom = (int) (interior.getMaxY() - getBulbDiameter());
979        Rectangle2D dataArea = new Rectangle2D.Double(midX - getColumnRadius(),
980                stemTop, getColumnRadius(), stemBottom - stemTop);
981
982        outerBulb.setFrame(midX - getBulbRadius(), stemBottom,
983                getBulbDiameter(), getBulbDiameter());
984
985        outerStem.setRoundRect(midX - getColumnRadius(), interior.getMinY(),
986                getColumnDiameter(), stemBottom + getBulbDiameter() - stemTop,
987                getColumnDiameter(), getColumnDiameter());
988
989        Area outerThermometer = new Area(outerBulb);
990        Area tempArea = new Area(outerStem);
991        outerThermometer.add(tempArea);
992
993        innerBulb.setFrame(midX - getBulbRadius() + getGap(), stemBottom
994                + getGap(), getBulbDiameter() - getGap() * 2, getBulbDiameter()
995                - getGap() * 2);
996
997        innerStem.setRoundRect(midX - getColumnRadius() + getGap(),
998                interior.getMinY() + getGap(), getColumnDiameter()
999                - getGap() * 2, stemBottom + getBulbDiameter() - getGap() * 2
1000                - stemTop, getColumnDiameter() - getGap() * 2,
1001                getColumnDiameter() - getGap() * 2);
1002
1003        Area innerThermometer = new Area(innerBulb);
1004        tempArea = new Area(innerStem);
1005        innerThermometer.add(tempArea);
1006
1007        if ((this.dataset != null) && (this.dataset.getValue() != null)) {
1008            double current = this.dataset.getValue().doubleValue();
1009            double ds = this.rangeAxis.valueToJava2D(current, dataArea,
1010                    RectangleEdge.LEFT);
1011
1012            int i = getColumnDiameter() - getGap() * 2; // already calculated
1013            int j = getColumnRadius() - getGap(); // already calculated
1014            int l = (i / 2);
1015            int k = (int) Math.round(ds);
1016            if (k < (getGap() + interior.getMinY())) {
1017                k = (int) (getGap() + interior.getMinY());
1018                l = getBulbRadius();
1019            }
1020
1021            Area mercury = new Area(innerBulb);
1022
1023            if (k < (stemBottom + getBulbRadius())) {
1024                mercuryStem.setRoundRect(midX - j, k, i,
1025                        (stemBottom + getBulbRadius()) - k, l, l);
1026                tempArea = new Area(mercuryStem);
1027                mercury.add(tempArea);
1028            }
1029
1030            g2.setPaint(getCurrentPaint());
1031            g2.fill(mercury);
1032
1033            // draw range indicators...
1034            if (this.subrangeIndicatorsVisible) {
1035                g2.setStroke(this.subrangeIndicatorStroke);
1036                Range range = this.rangeAxis.getRange();
1037
1038                // draw start of normal range
1039                double value = this.thermometerPlotProduct.getSubrangeInfo()[NORMAL][RANGE_LOW];
1040                if (range.contains(value)) {
1041                    double x = midX + getColumnRadius() + 2;
1042                    double y = this.rangeAxis.valueToJava2D(value, dataArea,
1043                            RectangleEdge.LEFT);
1044                    Line2D line = new Line2D.Double(x, y, x + 10, y);
1045                    g2.setPaint(this.subrangePaint[NORMAL]);
1046                    g2.draw(line);
1047                }
1048
1049                // draw start of warning range
1050                value = this.thermometerPlotProduct.getSubrangeInfo()[WARNING][RANGE_LOW];
1051                if (range.contains(value)) {
1052                    double x = midX + getColumnRadius() + 2;
1053                    double y = this.rangeAxis.valueToJava2D(value, dataArea,
1054                            RectangleEdge.LEFT);
1055                    Line2D line = new Line2D.Double(x, y, x + 10, y);
1056                    g2.setPaint(this.subrangePaint[WARNING]);
1057                    g2.draw(line);
1058                }
1059
1060                // draw start of critical range
1061                value = this.thermometerPlotProduct.getSubrangeInfo()[CRITICAL][RANGE_LOW];
1062                if (range.contains(value)) {
1063                    double x = midX + getColumnRadius() + 2;
1064                    double y = this.rangeAxis.valueToJava2D(value, dataArea,
1065                            RectangleEdge.LEFT);
1066                    Line2D line = new Line2D.Double(x, y, x + 10, y);
1067                    g2.setPaint(this.subrangePaint[CRITICAL]);
1068                    g2.draw(line);
1069                }
1070            }
1071
1072            // draw the axis...
1073            if ((this.rangeAxis != null) && (this.axisLocation != NONE)) {
1074                int drawWidth = AXIS_GAP;
1075                if (this.showValueLines) {
1076                    drawWidth += getColumnDiameter();
1077                }
1078                Rectangle2D drawArea;
1079                double cursor;
1080
1081                switch (this.axisLocation) {
1082                    case RIGHT:
1083                        cursor = midX + getColumnRadius();
1084                        drawArea = new Rectangle2D.Double(cursor,
1085                                stemTop, drawWidth, (stemBottom - stemTop + 1));
1086                        this.rangeAxis.draw(g2, cursor, area, drawArea,
1087                                RectangleEdge.RIGHT, null);
1088                        break;
1089
1090                    case LEFT:
1091                    default:
1092                        //cursor = midX - COLUMN_RADIUS - AXIS_GAP;
1093                        cursor = midX - getColumnRadius();
1094                        drawArea = new Rectangle2D.Double(cursor, stemTop,
1095                                drawWidth, (stemBottom - stemTop + 1));
1096                        this.rangeAxis.draw(g2, cursor, area, drawArea,
1097                                RectangleEdge.LEFT, null);
1098                        break;
1099                }
1100
1101            }
1102
1103            // draw text value on screen
1104            g2.setFont(this.valueFont);
1105            g2.setPaint(this.valuePaint);
1106            metrics = g2.getFontMetrics();
1107            switch (this.valueLocation) {
1108                case RIGHT:
1109                    g2.drawString(this.valueFormat.format(current),
1110                            midX + getColumnRadius() + getGap(), midY);
1111                    break;
1112                case LEFT:
1113                    String valueString = this.valueFormat.format(current);
1114                    int stringWidth = metrics.stringWidth(valueString);
1115                    g2.drawString(valueString, midX - getColumnRadius()
1116                            - getGap() - stringWidth, midY);
1117                    break;
1118                case BULB:
1119                    temp = this.valueFormat.format(current);
1120                    i = metrics.stringWidth(temp) / 2;
1121                    g2.drawString(temp, midX - i,
1122                            stemBottom + getBulbRadius() + getGap());
1123                    break;
1124                default:
1125            }
1126            /***/
1127        }
1128
1129        g2.setPaint(this.thermometerPaint);
1130        g2.setFont(this.valueFont);
1131
1132        //  draw units indicator
1133        metrics = g2.getFontMetrics();
1134        int tickX1 = midX - getColumnRadius() - getGap() * 2
1135                     - metrics.stringWidth(UNITS[this.units]);
1136        if (tickX1 > area.getMinX()) {
1137            g2.drawString(UNITS[this.units], tickX1,
1138                    (int) (area.getMinY() + 20));
1139        }
1140
1141        // draw thermometer outline
1142        g2.setStroke(this.thermometerStroke);
1143        g2.draw(outerThermometer);
1144        g2.draw(innerThermometer);
1145
1146        drawOutline(g2, area);
1147    }
1148
1149    /**
1150     * A zoom method that does nothing.  Plots are required to support the
1151     * zoom operation.  In the case of a thermometer chart, it doesn't make
1152     * sense to zoom in or out, so the method is empty.
1153     *
1154     * @param percent  the zoom percentage.
1155     */
1156    @Override
1157    public void zoom(double percent) {
1158        // intentionally blank
1159   }
1160
1161    /**
1162     * Returns a short string describing the type of plot.
1163     *
1164     * @return A short string describing the type of plot.
1165     */
1166    @Override
1167    public String getPlotType() {
1168        return localizationResources.getString("Thermometer_Plot");
1169    }
1170
1171    /**
1172     * Checks to see if a new value means the axis range needs adjusting.
1173     *
1174     * @param event  the dataset change event.
1175     */
1176    @Override
1177    public void datasetChanged(DatasetChangeEvent event) {
1178        if (this.dataset != null) {
1179            Number vn = this.dataset.getValue();
1180            if (vn != null) {
1181                double value = vn.doubleValue();
1182                if (thermometerPlotProduct.inSubrange(NORMAL, value)) {
1183                    this.subrange = NORMAL;
1184                }
1185                else if (thermometerPlotProduct.inSubrange(WARNING, value)) {
1186                   this.subrange = WARNING;
1187                }
1188                else if (thermometerPlotProduct.inSubrange(CRITICAL, value)) {
1189                    this.subrange = CRITICAL;
1190                }
1191                else {
1192                    this.subrange = -1;
1193                }
1194                setAxisRange();
1195            }
1196        }
1197        super.datasetChanged(event);
1198    }
1199
1200    /**
1201     * Returns the data range.
1202     *
1203     * @param axis  the axis.
1204     *
1205     * @return The range of data displayed.
1206     */
1207    @Override
1208    public Range getDataRange(ValueAxis axis) {
1209       return new Range(this.lowerBound, this.upperBound);
1210    }
1211
1212    /**
1213     * Sets the axis range to the current values in the rangeInfo array.
1214     */
1215    protected void setAxisRange() {
1216        if ((this.subrange >= 0) && (this.followDataInSubranges)) {
1217            this.rangeAxis.setRange(
1218                    new Range(this.thermometerPlotProduct.getSubrangeInfo()[this.subrange][DISPLAY_LOW],
1219                    this.thermometerPlotProduct.getSubrangeInfo()[this.subrange][DISPLAY_HIGH]));
1220        }
1221        else {
1222            this.rangeAxis.setRange(this.lowerBound, this.upperBound);
1223        }
1224    }
1225
1226    /**
1227     * Returns the legend items for the plot.
1228     *
1229     * @return {@code null}.
1230     */
1231    @Override
1232    public LegendItemCollection getLegendItems() {
1233        return null;
1234    }
1235
1236    /**
1237     * Returns the orientation of the plot.
1238     *
1239     * @return The orientation (always {@link PlotOrientation#VERTICAL}).
1240     */
1241    @Override
1242    public PlotOrientation getOrientation() {
1243        return PlotOrientation.VERTICAL;
1244    }
1245
1246    /**
1247     * Determine whether a number is valid and finite.
1248     *
1249     * @param d  the number to be tested.
1250     *
1251     * @return {@code true} if the number is valid and finite, and
1252     *         {@code false} otherwise.
1253     */
1254    protected static boolean isValidNumber(double d) {
1255        return (!(Double.isNaN(d) || Double.isInfinite(d)));
1256    }
1257
1258    /**
1259     * Returns the mercury paint corresponding to the current data value.
1260     * Called from the {@link #draw(Graphics2D, Rectangle2D, Point2D,
1261     * PlotState, PlotRenderingInfo)} method.
1262     *
1263     * @return The paint (never {@code null}).
1264     */
1265    private Paint getCurrentPaint() {
1266        Paint result = this.mercuryPaint;
1267        if (this.useSubrangePaint) {
1268            double value = this.dataset.getValue().doubleValue();
1269            if (thermometerPlotProduct.inSubrange(NORMAL, value)) {
1270                result = this.subrangePaint[NORMAL];
1271            }
1272            else if (thermometerPlotProduct.inSubrange(WARNING, value)) {
1273                result = this.subrangePaint[WARNING];
1274            }
1275            else if (thermometerPlotProduct.inSubrange(CRITICAL, value)) {
1276                result = this.subrangePaint[CRITICAL];
1277            }
1278        }
1279        return result;
1280    }
1281
1282    /**
1283     * Tests this plot for equality with another object.  The plot's dataset
1284     * is not considered in the test.
1285     *
1286     * @param obj  the object ({@code null} permitted).
1287     *
1288     * @return {@code true} or {@code false}.
1289     */
1290    @Override
1291    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1292        if (obj == this) {
1293            return true;
1294        }
1295        if (!(obj instanceof ThermometerPlot)) {
1296            return false;
1297        }
1298        ThermometerPlot that = (ThermometerPlot) obj;
1299        if (!super.equals(obj)) {
1300            return false;
1301        }
1302        if (!Objects.equals(this.rangeAxis, that.rangeAxis)) {
1303            return false;
1304        }
1305        if (this.axisLocation != that.axisLocation) {
1306            return false;
1307        }
1308        if (this.lowerBound != that.lowerBound) {
1309            return false;
1310        }
1311        if (this.upperBound != that.upperBound) {
1312            return false;
1313        }
1314        if (!Objects.equals(this.padding, that.padding)) {
1315            return false;
1316        }
1317        if (!Objects.equals(this.thermometerStroke, that.thermometerStroke)) {
1318            return false;
1319        }
1320        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.thermometerPaint,
1321                that.thermometerPaint)) {
1322            return false;
1323        }
1324        if (this.units != that.units) {
1325            return false;
1326        }
1327        if (this.valueLocation != that.valueLocation) {
1328            return false;
1329        }
1330        if (!Objects.equals(this.valueFont, that.valueFont)) {
1331            return false;
1332        }
1333        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.valuePaint, that.valuePaint)) {
1334            return false;
1335        }
1336        if (!Objects.equals(this.valueFormat, that.valueFormat)) {
1337            return false;
1338        }
1339        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.mercuryPaint, that.mercuryPaint)) {
1340            return false;
1341        }
1342        if (this.showValueLines != that.showValueLines) {
1343            return false;
1344        }
1345        if (this.subrange != that.subrange) {
1346            return false;
1347        }
1348        if (this.followDataInSubranges != that.followDataInSubranges) {
1349            return false;
1350        }
1351        if (!equal(this.thermometerPlotProduct.getSubrangeInfo(), that.thermometerPlotProduct.getSubrangeInfo())) {
1352            return false;
1353        }
1354        if (this.useSubrangePaint != that.useSubrangePaint) {
1355            return false;
1356        }
1357        if (this.bulbRadius != that.bulbRadius) {
1358            return false;
1359        }
1360        if (this.columnRadius != that.columnRadius) {
1361            return false;
1362        }
1363        if (this.gap != that.gap) {
1364            return false;
1365        }
1366        for (int i = 0; i < this.subrangePaint.length; i++) {
1367            if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.subrangePaint[i],
1368                    that.subrangePaint[i])) {
1369                return false;
1370            }
1371        }
1372        return true;
1373    }
1374
1375    /**
1376     * Tests two double[][] arrays for equality.
1377     *
1378     * @param array1  the first array ({@code null} permitted).
1379     * @param array2  the second arrray ({@code null} permitted).
1380     *
1381     * @return A boolean.
1382     */
1383    private static boolean equal(double[][] array1, double[][] array2) {
1384        if (array1 == null) {
1385            return (array2 == null);
1386        }
1387        if (array2 == null) {
1388            return false;
1389        }
1390        if (array1.length != array2.length) {
1391            return false;
1392        }
1393        for (int i = 0; i < array1.length; i++) {
1394            if (!Arrays.equals(array1[i], array2[i])) {
1395                return false;
1396            }
1397        }
1398        return true;
1399    }
1400
1401    /**
1402     * Returns a clone of the plot.
1403     *
1404     * @return A clone.
1405     *
1406     * @throws CloneNotSupportedException  if the plot cannot be cloned.
1407     */
1408    @Override
1409    public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
1410
1411        ThermometerPlot clone = (ThermometerPlot) super.clone();
1412                clone.thermometerPlotProduct = (ThermometerPlotProduct) this.thermometerPlotProduct.clone();
1413
1414        if (clone.dataset != null) {
1415            clone.dataset.addChangeListener(clone);
1416        }
1417        clone.rangeAxis = CloneUtils.clone(this.rangeAxis);
1418        if (clone.rangeAxis != null) {
1419            clone.rangeAxis.setPlot(clone);
1420            clone.rangeAxis.addChangeListener(clone);
1421        }
1422        clone.valueFormat = (NumberFormat) this.valueFormat.clone();
1423        clone.subrangePaint = (Paint[]) this.subrangePaint.clone();
1424
1425        return clone;
1426
1427    }
1428
1429    /**
1430     * Provides serialization support.
1431     *
1432     * @param stream  the output stream.
1433     *
1434     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1435     */
1436    private void writeObject(ObjectOutputStream stream) throws IOException {
1437        stream.defaultWriteObject();
1438        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.thermometerStroke, stream);
1439        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.thermometerPaint, stream);
1440        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.valuePaint, stream);
1441        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.mercuryPaint, stream);
1442        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.subrangeIndicatorStroke, stream);
1443        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.rangeIndicatorStroke, stream);
1444        for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
1445            SerialUtils.writePaint(this.subrangePaint[i], stream);
1446        }
1447    }
1448
1449    /**
1450     * Provides serialization support.
1451     *
1452     * @param stream  the input stream.
1453     *
1454     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1455     * @throws ClassNotFoundException  if there is a classpath problem.
1456     */
1457    private void readObject(ObjectInputStream stream) throws IOException,
1458            ClassNotFoundException {
1459        stream.defaultReadObject();
1460        this.thermometerStroke = SerialUtils.readStroke(stream);
1461        this.thermometerPaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
1462        this.valuePaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
1463        this.mercuryPaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
1464        this.subrangeIndicatorStroke = SerialUtils.readStroke(stream);
1465        this.rangeIndicatorStroke = SerialUtils.readStroke(stream);
1466        this.subrangePaint = new Paint[3];
1467        for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
1468            this.subrangePaint[i] = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
1469        }
1470        if (this.rangeAxis != null) {
1471            this.rangeAxis.addChangeListener(this);
1472        }
1473    }
1474
1475    /**
1476     * Multiplies the range on the domain axis/axes by the specified factor.
1477     *
1478     * @param factor  the zoom factor.
1479     * @param state  the plot state.
1480     * @param source  the source point.
1481     */
1482    @Override
1483    public void zoomDomainAxes(double factor, PlotRenderingInfo state,
1484                               Point2D source) {
1485        // no domain axis to zoom
1486    }
1487
1488    /**
1489     * Multiplies the range on the domain axis/axes by the specified factor.
1490     *
1491     * @param factor  the zoom factor.
1492     * @param state  the plot state.
1493     * @param source  the source point.
1494     * @param useAnchor  a flag that controls whether or not the source point
1495     *         is used for the zoom anchor.
1496     */
1497    @Override
1498    public void zoomDomainAxes(double factor, PlotRenderingInfo state,
1499                               Point2D source, boolean useAnchor) {
1500        // no domain axis to zoom
1501    }
1502
1503    /**
1504     * Multiplies the range on the range axis/axes by the specified factor.
1505     *
1506     * @param factor  the zoom factor.
1507     * @param state  the plot state.
1508     * @param source  the source point.
1509     */
1510    @Override
1511    public void zoomRangeAxes(double factor, PlotRenderingInfo state,
1512                              Point2D source) {
1513        this.rangeAxis.resizeRange(factor);
1514    }
1515
1516    /**
1517     * Multiplies the range on the range axis/axes by the specified factor.
1518     *
1519     * @param factor  the zoom factor.
1520     * @param state  the plot state.
1521     * @param source  the source point.
1522     * @param useAnchor  a flag that controls whether or not the source point
1523     *         is used for the zoom anchor.
1524     */
1525    @Override
1526    public void zoomRangeAxes(double factor, PlotRenderingInfo state,
1527                              Point2D source, boolean useAnchor) {
1528        double anchorY = this.getRangeAxis().java2DToValue(source.getY(),
1529                state.getDataArea(), RectangleEdge.LEFT);
1530        this.rangeAxis.resizeRange(factor, anchorY);
1531    }
1532
1533    /**
1534     * This method does nothing.
1535     *
1536     * @param lowerPercent  the lower percent.
1537     * @param upperPercent  the upper percent.
1538     * @param state  the plot state.
1539     * @param source  the source point.
1540     */
1541    @Override
1542    public void zoomDomainAxes(double lowerPercent, double upperPercent,
1543                               PlotRenderingInfo state, Point2D source) {
1544        // no domain axis to zoom
1545    }
1546
1547    /**
1548     * Zooms the range axes.
1549     *
1550     * @param lowerPercent  the lower percent.
1551     * @param upperPercent  the upper percent.
1552     * @param state  the plot state.
1553     * @param source  the source point.
1554     */
1555    @Override
1556    public void zoomRangeAxes(double lowerPercent, double upperPercent,
1557                              PlotRenderingInfo state, Point2D source) {
1558        this.rangeAxis.zoomRange(lowerPercent, upperPercent);
1559    }
1560
1561    /**
1562     * Returns {@code false}.
1563     *
1564     * @return A boolean.
1565     */
1566    @Override
1567    public boolean isDomainZoomable() {
1568        return false;
1569    }
1570
1571    /**
1572     * Returns {@code true}.
1573     *
1574     * @return A boolean.
1575     */
1576    @Override
1577    public boolean isRangeZoomable() {
1578        return true;
1579    }
1580
1581}
